org.lightsleep

Interface Transaction

  • Functional Interface:
    This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.

    @FunctionalInterface
public interface Transaction
    A functional interface to execute transactions.
    Example
     Transaction.execute(connection -> {
     new Sql<>(Person.class)
         .update(connection, person);
 });
    Author:
    Masato Kokubo

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void commit(java.sql.Connection connection)
      If the connection is not auto-commit, commits the transaction.
      static void execute(ConnectionSupplier connectionSupplier, Transaction transaction)
      Executes the transaction in the following order.

      Gets a database connection by calling connectionSupplier.get(). Calls transaction.executeBody method. Commits the transaction. Closes the database connection.
      If an exception is thrown executing the transaction body, rollbacks rather than commit.

      Describe the transaction body in transaction using a lumbda expression.
      static void execute(Transaction transaction)
      Executes the transaction in the following order.

      Gets a database connection by calling Sql.getConnectionSupplier().get(). Calls transaction.executeBody method. Commits the transaction. Closes the database connection.
      If an exception is thrown executing the transaction body, rollbacks rather than commit.

      Describe the transaction body in transaction using a lumbda expression.
      void executeBody(java.sql.Connection connection)
      Describe the body of the transaction in this method.
      static void rollback(java.sql.Connection connection)
      If the connection is not auto-commit, rollbacks the transaction.

    • Method Detail

      • executeBody

        void executeBody(java.sql.Connection connection)
          throws java.lang.Exception
        Describe the body of the transaction in this method.
        Parameters:
        connection - the database connection
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if an error occurred

      • execute

        static void execute(Transaction transaction)
        Executes the transaction in the following order.

        1. Gets a database connection by calling Sql.getConnectionSupplier().get().
        2. Calls transaction.executeBody method.
        3. Commits the transaction.
        4. Closes the database connection.

        If an exception is thrown executing the transaction body, rollbacks rather than commit.

        Describe the transaction body in transaction using a lumbda expression.
        Parameters:
        transaction - a Transaction object
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if transaction is null
        RuntimeSQLException - if a SQLException is thrown while accessing the database

      • execute

        static void execute(ConnectionSupplier connectionSupplier,
                    Transaction transaction)
        Executes the transaction in the following order.

        1. Gets a database connection by calling connectionSupplier.get().
        2. Calls transaction.executeBody method.
        3. Commits the transaction.
        4. Closes the database connection.

        If an exception is thrown executing the transaction body, rollbacks rather than commit.

        Describe the transaction body in transaction using a lumbda expression.
        Parameters:
        connectionSupplier - a ConnectionSupplier object
        transaction - a Transaction object
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if connectionSupplier or transaction is null
        RuntimeSQLException - if a SQLException is thrown while accessing the database
        Since:
        1.5.0

      • commit

        static void commit(java.sql.Connection connection)
        If the connection is not auto-commit, commits the transaction.
        Parameters:
        connection - the database connection
        Throws:
        RuntimeSQLException - if a SQLException is thrown while accessing the database

      • rollback

        static void rollback(java.sql.Connection connection)
        If the connection is not auto-commit, rollbacks the transaction.
        Parameters:
        connection - the database connection
        Throws:
        RuntimeSQLException - if a SQLException is thrown while accessing the database
